fields.name: location_why
fields.content: At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your contact information and location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Please drag and zoom the map to center the pin on your property.

fields.name: private-address
fields.prompt: Or, search by address:
fields.placeholder: Your address will never be shared

fields.name: which_watershed
fields.prompt: Of the four WRIA regions on the map (Queets-Quinault, Lower Chehalis, Upper Chehalis and Willapa ), where is your project area primarily located?

fields.name: wetlands_information
fields.content:
Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: Are there any wetlands? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: frequently_flooded_information
fields.content:
Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: Are there any frequently flooded areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: geologic_hazard_information
fields.content:
Description

Severe geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: Are there any severe geologic hazard areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: critical_aquifer_information
fields.content:
Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: Are there any critical aquifer recharge areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_information
fields.content:
Description

Fish & wildlife conservation areas are managed to maintain populations of fish and wildlife.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wildlife_conservation
fields.prompt: Are there any fish & wildlife conservation areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: almost_done
fields.content:
14. Almost Completed!

This page will determine how your information is shared. We will report all practices at the watershed analysis unit scale, but if you are interested in having your project showcased you can give us permission below. Either way, we will be using your stewardship practice to capture how agriculture is protecting and/or restoring critical areas and maintaining the viability of agriculture.

fields.name: my_image
fields.prompt: Show your stewardship practices! Upload photos before, during, or after you implemented your stewardship practices:
fields.label: Upload photos

fields.name: share_photos
fields.prompt: Can The Grays Harbor Conservervation District highlight your photos in our current media platforms?

content.label: No, Share my project information with Grays Harbor Conservation District only.
Id like more information. (For more information, contact GHCD @ (360) 249-8532)

fields.name: private
fields.prompt: Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public? (Checking "yes" below will place a pin on the map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be visible to the public.)

content.label: Yes (Checking "yes" will place a pin on this map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be published.)
No, share my project information with Grays Harbor Conservation District only.
No, I'd like more information (For more information, contact GHCD @ (360) 249-8532)

fields.name: contact_interest
fields.prompt: Would you like to be contacted about potential project ideas?

content:
Welcome Grays Harbor Conservation District!

Get Started

The Grays Harbor Conservation District utilizes many local, state and federal resources to fund and manage the implementation of natural resource projects throughout our territory and we know that many of our local landowners are doing the same!

To better share the Grays Harbor stewardship story GHCD has put this mapping / survey tool together where stewards can share as much or as little about their efforts as they would like. We encourage you to share your stewardship and we thank you!
